title: Cross-trait associations
text: look four datasets: anx, bip, dep, scz. Let’s explore one : dataset represents GWAS anxiety. six columns represent: SNP: row one SNP, identified rs-id. A1: effect allele. A2: non-effect allele. Z: z-value. P: corresponding p-value. N: sample size.

title: Cross-trait associations
text: four datasets columns. also overlapping SNP. , however, cover SNPs. first make sure sets analyze cover SNPs. , show one possible way :
code: common_snps <- Reduce(intersect, lapply(ss, function(x) x$SNP)) print(common_snps) #> [1] "rs3" "rs4" "rs5" "rs6" "rs7"  ss_common <- lapply(ss, function(x) subset(x, SNP %in% common_snps)) names(ss_common) <- names(ss) print(ss_common$anx) #>   SNP A1 A2     Z            P     N #> 3 rs3  C  A -1.52 1.285110e-01 25000 #> 4 rs4  G  A  1.03 3.030100e-01 25000 #> 5 rs5  G  T  4.22 2.443023e-05 25000 #> 6 rs6  C  T -0.61 5.418618e-01 25000 #> 7 rs7  A  C -1.59 1.118348e-01 25000

title: Cross-trait associations
text: Next, need make , , variables, depending cross-trait association methods want use (example, needs ).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sander Lamballais. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lamballais S (2024). ctar: Cross-trait association methods R. R package version 0.2.3, https://slamballais.github.io/ctar/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ctar: Cross-trait association methods in R},   author = {Sander Lamballais},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.3},   url = {https://slamballais.github.io/ctar/}, }

title: Cross-trait association methods in R
text: ctar offers standardized versions cross-trait association methods.

title: Cross-trait association methods in R
code: # Install development version from GitHub pak::pak("slamballais/ctar")

title: Cross-trait association methods in R
code: library(ctar)  p <- replicate(2, runif(100000), simplify = FALSE) out <- sumrank(p)

title: Cross-trait association methods in R
text: PLACO method published Debashree Ray Nilanjan Chatterjee 2020. code PLACO implementation heavily based PLACO R function. CPMA method published Chris Cotsapas colleagues 2011. code CPMA implementation loosely based original code Chris.

title: Anxiety — anx
text: hypothetical anxiety GWAS 7 SNPs.

title: Anxiety — anx
text: data frame six variables: SNP rs-id SNP A1 effect allele A2 non-effect allele Z z-value P p-value N sample size

title: Bipolar disorder — bip
text: hypothetical bipolar disorder GWAS 8 SNPs.

title: Bipolar disorder — bip
text: data frame six variables: SNP rs-id SNP A1 effect allele A2 non-effect allele Z z-value P p-value N sample size

title: Checking n_cores argument — check_cores
text: Checks validity n_cores input argument used within ctar package.

title: Checking n_cores argument — check_cores
text: n_cores integer. number cores used, parallel processing.

title: Checking n_cores argument — check_cores
text: `NULL`, invisibly. function called side effects.

what: Checking p and maxval arguments — check_p
title: Checking p and maxval arguments — check_p
text: Checks validity p maxval input arguments used within ctar package.

title: Checking p and maxval arguments — check_p
Checking p and maxval arguments — check_p
text: p list numeric vectors. Contains p-values GWAS. maxval numeric scalar range \((0, 1]\) (default: 1). maximum value p-values considered analysis. two_traits logical (default: FALSE). call two traits?

title: Checking p and maxval arguments — check_p
text: check_p returns list three elements: number_of_traits: number traits. number_of_snps: number SNPs. p_matrix: p matrix.

title: Checking p and maxval arguments — check_p

what: Checking z and z_var arguments — check_z
title: Checking z and z_var arguments — check_z
text: Checks validity z z_var input arguments used within ctar package.

title: Checking z and z_var arguments — check_z
Checking z and z_var arguments — check_z
text: z list numeric vectors. Contains z-scores GWAS. z_var numeric vector. Contains variances element z. two_traits logical (default: FALSE). call two traits?

title: Checking z and z_var arguments — check_z
text: `NULL`, invisibly. function called side effects.

title: Checking z and z_var arguments — check_z
code: z <- list(c(1, 1.1), c(1, 1.3)) z_var <- c(0.95, 0.97) check_z(z, z_var, two_traits = TRUE)

title: Run CPMA on p-values — cpma
text: function allows run cross-phenotype meta-analysis (CPMA) method p-values GWAS summary statistics, given variety parameters.

title: Run CPMA on p-values — cpma
code: cpma(p, epsilon = 0.001, p_threshold = 5e-08, maxval = 1, fixed = TRUE)

title: Run CPMA on p-values — cpma
text: p list numeric vectors. Contains p-values GWAS. epsilon numeric scalar (default: 0.001). Offset parameter. p_threshold Numeric scalar (default: 5E-8). threshold deem association statistically significant. maxval numeric scalar range \((0, 1]\) (default: 1). maximum value p-values considered analysis. fixed logical (default: TRUE). cross-trait association >1 traits reaches p_threshold single trait lowest p-value combinations, return result >1 traits instead. avoid scenarios seem cross-trait association, suppressed due statistical properties.

title: Run CPMA on p-values — cpma
text: Returns list four elements, focused optimal subset SNP: p: numeric vector. SNP, p-value optimal   subset. n: numeric vector. SNP, number traits   optimal subset. traits: list characters. SNP, names   traits optimal subset. p_exp: numeric vector. SNP, -log10 p-value   optimal subset.

title: Run CPMA on p-values — cpma
code: p <- replicate(10, runif(100), simplify = FALSE) out <- cpma(p)

title: Depression — dep
text: hypothetical depression GWAS 7 SNPs.

title: Depression — dep
text: data frame six variables: SNP rs-id SNP A1 effect allele A2 non-effect allele Z z-value P p-value N sample size

title: Sort ordering numeric vectors — fastorder
text: Order numeric vector ascending order. Identical values ordered descending order occurrence.

title: Sort ordering numeric vectors — fastorder
text: x numeric vector.

title: Sort ordering numeric vectors — fastorder
text: fastorder returns list two elements: x: numeric vector. ordered version vector. ix: numeric vector. corresponding indices.

title: Run FCT on p-values — fct
text: function allows run Fisher's combined probability test (FCT) method p-values GWAS summary statistics, given variety parameters.

title: Run FCT on p-values — fct
text: p list numeric vectors. Contains p-values GWAS. p_threshold Numeric scalar (default: 5E-8). threshold deem association statistically significant. maxval numeric scalar range \((0, 1]\) (default: 1). maximum value p-values considered analysis. fixed logical (default: TRUE). cross-trait association >1 traits reaches p_threshold single trait lowest p-value combinations, return result >1 traits instead. avoid scenarios seem cross-trait association, suppressed due statistical properties.

title: Run FCT on p-values — fct
text: Returns list four elements, focused optimal subset SNP: p: numeric vector. SNP, p-value optimal   subset. n: numeric vector. SNP, number traits   optimal subset. traits: list characters. SNP, names   traits optimal subset. p_exp: numeric vector. SNP, -log10 p-value   optimal subset.

title: Run FCT on p-values — fct
code: p <- replicate(10, runif(100), simplify = FALSE) out <- fct(p)

title: Run PLACO on z-scores — placo
text: function allows run PLACO method z-scores GWAS summary statistics, given variety parameters. code function heavily borrowed original PLACO function written Debashree Jay Nilanjan Chatterjee (https://github.com/RayDebashree/PLACO).

title: Run PLACO on z-scores — placo
text: z list numeric vectors. Contains z-scores GWAS. z_var numeric vector. Contains variances z element. n_cores integer (default: 1). Number cores used.

title: Run PLACO on z-scores — placo
text: Returns numeric vector containing p-values PLACO.

title: Schizophrenia — scz
text: hypothetical schizophrenia GWAS 8 SNPs.

title: Schizophrenia — scz
text: data frame six variables: SNP rs-id SNP A1 effect allele A2 non-effect allele Z z-value P p-value N sample size

title: Run SumRank on p-values — sumrank
text: function allows run SumRank method p-values GWAS summary statistics, given variety parameters.

title: Run SumRank on p-values — sumrank
code: sumrank(p, fixed_names = NULL, p_threshold = 5e-08, maxval = 1, fixed = TRUE)

title: Run SumRank on p-values — sumrank
text: p list numeric vectors. Contains p-values GWAS. fixed_names list characters. element list contains set traits (names p) least one trait present final result SNP. p_threshold Numeric scalar (default: 5E-8). threshold deem association statistically significant. maxval numeric scalar range \((0, 1]\) (default: 1). maximum value p-values considered analysis. fixed logical (default: TRUE). cross-trait association >1 traits reaches p_threshold single trait lowest p-value combinations, return result >1 traits instead. avoid scenarios seem cross-trait association, suppressed due statistical properties.

title: Run SumRank on p-values — sumrank
text: Returns list four elements, focused optimal subset SNP: p: numeric vector. SNP, p-value optimal   subset. n: numeric vector. SNP, number traits   optimal subset. traits: list characters. SNP, names   traits optimal subset. p_exp: numeric vector. SNP, -log10 p-value   optimal subset.

title: Run SumRank on p-values — sumrank
code: p <- replicate(10, runif(100), simplify = FALSE) out <- sumrank(p)

title: ctar 0.2.3 (2024-08-28)
text: minor update mostly focused documentation.

title: ctar 0.2.3 (2024-08-28)
text: 19e18b1: Fixed placo can accept 2 traits. f406a97: Modified “z-value” “z-score.”

title: ctar 0.2.3 (2024-08-28)
text: #26: Filled help pages (except examples) main functions. #26: Added examples help pages. 1fc071c: Added one vignette. 759025d: Initiated pkgdown website (https://slamballais.github.io/ctar).

title: ctar 0.2.2 (2024-08-27)
text: 8f7a2cd: Removed unnecessary values Imports field. 0c21c9b: Make sure R CMD CHECK passed successfully.

title: ctar 0.2.2 (2024-08-27)
text: 23d7741: Add R CMD CHECK badge GitHub. 098a69f: Updated looks NEWS.md. #24: Added codecov checks. 832cf03: Added GitHub Actions PR commands. 271d077: Modified argument names fit lintr (e.g., .MAXVAL maxval). 56baa27: Increase test coverage.

title: ctar 0.2.1 (2024-08-27)
text: #10: Added internal functions checks input arguments. #11: Added p_exp (-log10 p-values) output cpma fct. #12: Added tests non-subset sumrank, cpma, fct. b9c3e56: Added tests see p-values equal 0. #16: Modified z_in z, p_in p. Added checks z.

title: ctar 0.2.0 (2024-08-26)
text: Version 0.2.0 extends beyond sumrank adds number necessary features.

title: ctar 0.2.0 (2024-08-26)
text: #1: Implemented initial testing framework. a5d2280: Implemented PLACO (“pleiotropic analysis composite null hypothesis”) placo. #6: Implemented CPMA (“cross-phenotype meta-analysis”) cpma. #8: Implemented FCT (“Fisher’s combined probability test”) fct.

title: ctar 0.1.0 (2024-08-26)
text: first version ctar: cross-trait associations R. version purely contains necessary files R package, well uncleaned version sumrank. add features soon!
